column4: Anyone know why I'm havng issues installing (well reinstalling now as something f*cked it up) my tex/tetex packages
it has a problem with udpmap or something to that extent
: what error are you getting?
mktexfmt: Error! Not all formats have been built successfully
on all tex-operations
I think it might have something to do with the file /etc/texmk/dvipi.cfg (iirc), as it appears that the lhs2stex package changed this somewhat
how do I get the error-log from synaptic, cause as soon as it finishes you can't select the text anymore
it seems to be an issue when it calls fmtutil-sys during the configuration of tetex
: Try looking in /var/log/dpkg.log
aha
http://rafb.net/p/XTOgUp36.html
: this is a bit over my head, but try doing find / | grep mp.pool
ouch
ok, thanks :)
: its a long shot, but try: apt-get -f install
no still a problem with that fmtutil thingy
: sorry :/
how do I check to which package a file belongs
: sorry about the late reply, some network issues here, dpkg -S will tell you what file is in a package (providing that you have it installed)
